boardgame.name: Blaze The Cat: Fire & Safety Rescue Game
boardgame.description:
This is an educational game designed for children ages 5 and older. The game "teaches children and families about different types of fire equipment and their uses. Additionally and most importantly it shows that it is always better to be a Team Player."

Each kid is represented by a Blaze The Cat firefighter token. The board represents a 10 story building with 8 rooms or stairways on each floor. The players race to the roof and then jump into the rescue helicopter. The first player to reach the top is the winner but all of the children board the chopper at the end of the game... nobody dies.

The cards are intended to teach lessons about courtesy, safety, and the things firefighters do in an emergency. Players roll dice and draw cards to move during a turn. Some reading will be required unless a parent or older child reads the cards.

Includes 4 tokens, 70 cards, a die, a colorful board, and the rules.

boardgame.name: Divinity Core Rulebook
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

Enemies are everywhere. You are a Divinity; an entity given 'Divine' status by your mortal worshipers. You cannot watch your flock by yourself, so you will need allies in order to protect them. How will you keep your worshipers from being won over by rivals? Can you keep your Divinity?

The Divinity RPG is designed for those who want to role-play gods and goddesses. However, Divinity seeks to look beyond the anthromorphic approach of viewing them. How about becoming a member of a "machine collective" or being the spirit guide for your ancestral family?

Divinity makes very few assumptions about your game. You make it happen. Claim your Divinity!

What is Divinity? It is a 60+ page guide for running a RPG in which the players have god-like powers. It is designed to be stand alone as a settingless game or it is possible to use it as an aid for adding a layer of the "divine" into your own game.

The player is given a lot of power but he or she has a lot of responsibility as well. They depend on the worship and/or services provided by mortals. As a result, there is a give and take relationship with their worshipers. You will advice for considering scenerios taking place in the distant past to the far future. Nuture your mortals in the past or protect them for rivals in the future. Consider alternative dimensions or eras in between the distant past or the far future.

With ten power groups and the ability to decide what skills you want, it is easy to customize your character. A simple karma system for task resolution allows for a player to show up to your game with only a pen, some paper and an imagination.

boardgame.name: Cyber Troopers: Virtual-On Force
Dennō Senki Bācharon Fōsu
電脳戦機バーチャロン フォース
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Cyber Troopers: Virtual-On Force is a Japanese 3D Mech fighting game originally released in arcades. The game has since been scheduled to be re-released on the Xbox 360. The game focuses on tactical combat between large Mechs and shares many similarities with the other games in the series, but Virtual-On Force differs in that it features four player matches in a 2 vs. 2 format. In order to maintain game balance while adding the complexity of additional fighters, the game uses a much simplified combat engine to its predecessors.

The Xbox 360 edition stays true to the base game with the same gameplay style, and includes most of the features from the arcade version. Xbox Live support is included to allow players to play online.

boardgame.description:
"Prison Break: The Conspiracy is an action-adventure video game based on the first season of the Fox television series Prison Break, released for Microsoft Windows, Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3.

It was released on March 19, 2010 in Germany, March 26, 2010 in the United Kingdom and Europe, and March 30, 2010 in North America. The game had been in development for PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360 for release in February 2009, but was canceled when Brash Entertainment closed down. However, ZootFly continued the development and self-funded the project for 13 months. Once the game was polished and nearly finished, it was picked up by new publisher Deep Silver."

"Pop Island - Paperfield is a Nintendo DSi video game developed by ODENIS Studio. It is the sequel to Pop Island. It costs 200 Nintendo points, and can be downloaded at the DSi Shop. Pop Island - Paperfield is a capture the flag type game. The player's objective is to bring as many flags to their base as possible in a set amount of time, while trying to stop the opposing team from bringing flags to their base. The characters of Pop Island consist of 12 different animals and vehicles, such as a lion with wheels, surfing penguin, a fish, a skateboarding elephant and many others.

Paperfield offers a bonus for those who bought the previous title, as owners of both games can unlock three new maps and four vehicles, including a helicopter and a submarine."

boardgame.name: Quantum Legions: Vanguard
boardgame.description:
The publisher's blurb:
Quantum Legions™ is a game of science fiction ground combat — or more specifically, a series of games simulating battalion-level conflict within the universe of the Thirteen Provinces.

Innovative command and combat mechanics allow players to quickly and easily fight out any number of battles of varying sizes, keeping the focus on tactics rather than rules. Though designed as a "hex-n-counter" board game, Quantum Legions can easily be adapted as a miniatures wargame. Details on how this can be accomplished are provided in the rulebook.

Finally, like most Majestic Twelve products, Quantum Legions includes rules for creating your own units so you can add to its exciting background, simulate your favorite movies and television shows, or create your very own universe!

Quantum Legions: Wargaming on an Epic Scale.

Additional Details:
Units are represented by counters with basic information (movement, range, attack dice, etc.) Players roll 2d6 for the number of command points available at the beginning of the turn. Command points are used to remove suppression markers, activate ordered units and place orders on units to activate on future turns. Combat is bucket of dice with the target number depending on the attack order and number of dice modified by the target's terrain.

The PDF includes five 11"x17" map sections. Two map sections are used in the basic scenario. Also included are 1" unit counters and 5/8" order and suppression markers.
